thoughts.content:
# The Heart of Practice

The paper of the book contains a piece of everything in existence. It is a reflection of the entire cosmos. 

This idea holds true for the individual and their relationship to society. One person contains a piece of all of society and when we seek peace through meditation we are actually achieving a bit of the peace for society as well.

Just as each individual leaf nourishes the whole tree so do individual humans nourish the whole of society. One cannot help society as an entity separates from it because one cannot be separate from it in fact.

Meditation is not to be removed from society but to return and nourish it ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π

*******

1. We are meditating to clean up our side of the street in order to improve the whole world not just ourselves. What good is inner peace in a world where you can‚Äôt enjoy it.
2. Sharing the practice of meditation is the entire point. The sangha is the third gem for a reason. Share meditation with your friends and family so they may too clean their side of the street and make the world a better place one mind at a time.

*******

Remaining connected to society is the only way to fix it. This is why we practice meditation.

*******

Refuge in society is the only one we really have when all else fails. We cannot hide from society because we inter-are society.

*******

Practicing Buddhism in the little everyday moments is the idea of engaged Buddhism. One should practice smiling, breathing, and being mindful in all one‚Äôs activities.

*******

We can use Gathas to focus our mind and extend our practice to the non-practice times.

*******

Mrs. Nguyen‚Äôs name calling parable. Practice for quality over quantity. Deep, abiding practice will have lasting effects in your life. The idea of a 90 in 90 is to develop a deeper involvement in the fellowship not to trudge through the 90 meetings like a chore to be accomplished. This is why I have put no time limit on my one meeting a day goal -  until it feels right to stop. I am practicing not attaching to a goal or set end.

*******
